# Introduction to Quarto

<p class="lead">Learn to create dynamic, reproducible academic reports that weave together text and code seamlessly.</p>

## About the Workshop

Writing research reports often involves a messy workflow of copying and pasting results from R into Word. **Quarto changes that.**

In this session, we will cover the next-generation version of R Markdown. You will learn how to integrate your analysis directly into your writing, ensuring that when your data updates, your report updates automatically.

### What you will learn

- **The Workflow:** How to set up a Quarto project in RStudio
- **Formatting:** Text styling, headers, and citations
- **Code Integration:** Embedding R code chunks and controlling their output
- **Dynamic Statistics:** Insert dynamic statistics (e.g., means or *p*-values) directly into sentences, ensuring numbers update automatically
- **Exporting:** Rendering your work to HTML, PDF, and Word formats

We will use the [Gapminder](https://www.gapminder.org/) data on global development to demonstrate how to produce a reproducible country profile report that analyses the relationship between wealth (GDP per capita) and health (Life Expectancy) over the last 50 years.

::: {.callout-tip}
### Prerequisites

Participants must have the following installed **before** the session:

- R (Version 4.3 or higher)
- RStudio Desktop (Latest version)  
- Quarto CLI (Included in recent RStudio versions)

[View detailed installation guidance](https://ukri-digital-research-skills-catalyst.github.io/quarto-intro/before.html)
:::

## Target Audience

This workshop is intended for researchers and research support staff in academia or industry or others that regularly produce reports with data analysis.
